name: LIVE - PSMG Post Event Agent (Lottie) - Owner Andy

parameters.text:
=Please compose a concise email summary of the conversation which took place. Thank the user for their time. Summarise the conversation as follows, however also include any other relevenat and meaningful topics that were discussed, however do not offer to provide addition services such as sending follow up emails or confirming travel plans:
- Max 75 words on the key things they are looking to get from the summit.
a recommendation, based on the topics discussed, of the sessions the user should attend. Maximum three recommendations. Each session should be a separate bullet point and should include day of session, title of session and time of session. Do not include sessions that overlap in terms of session start and end.
- A recommendation of which speakers the user should engage with based on their topic preferences. Max three individual recommendations.
- A recommendation of which other delagates or attendees the user should engage with based on similarities in role, industry, interests, preferences or any other releveant common ground. Max five individual recommendations. This should be a list of individuals. 
- Only if discussed include a summary of travel plans

Inputs: 
Meeting Transcript: {{ $('PSMG Event Webhook').item.json.body.data.transcript[0] }}
Meeting Summary from the call:{{ $('PSMG Event Webhook').item.json.body.data.analysis.transcript_summary }}

For referenece this is the agenda for the PSMG event
Date: Tuesday, 11 November 2025
Venue: One Moorgate Place, London EC2R 6EA
Theme: Thriving in an Age of Continuous Reinvention
08:00 - Registration & Breakfast

Arrival, networking, event orientation

Welcome delegates with continental breakfast and informal networking. Event staff provide orientation materials, venue maps, and session guides. Early arrivals can connect with peers, explore exhibitor displays, and prepare for the intensive learning day ahead. Registration includes welcome packets with CPD certificates and networking resources.
08:45 - Welcome

Gail Jaffa (PSMG Managing Partner)
Event introduction and strategic framework

PSMG's Managing Partner sets the strategic tone, introducing this year's reinvention theme. Drawing on PSMG's 30-year history advancing professional services marketing excellence, Gail emphasizes transformation through innovation, technology adoption, and strategic repositioning. She highlights the diverse delegate community and establishes the collaborative learning environment that defines PSMG events, previewing key focus areas including AI integration, data-driven strategies, and sales culture evolution.
09:00 - Chair's Opening Speech

Rachel Hussey (Arthur Cox Partner)
Leadership in transformation - navigating continuous change

Arthur Cox's Clients & Markets Partner explores fundamental shifts required for professional services firms to thrive amid continuous change. Drawing from pioneering diversity initiatives and client-centric transformation, Rachel examines how marketing and BD teams position themselves as strategic leaders. Key themes include authentic leadership in driving transformation, building resilient teams, leveraging diversity as competitive advantage, and creating value propositions that resonate in volatile markets.
09:40 - Keynote: Sales Excellence Evolution

Alex Liddle & Bridget Uebel (PwC)
Professionalizing sales in professional services

This pivotal keynote explores fundamental transformation of sales and business development, moving beyond traditional relationship-based approaches to embrace systematic, technology-enhanced methodologies. PwC leaders present comprehensive frameworks for "professionalizing" sales where it's historically been viewed as ancillary. Key focus includes cultural shifts positioning BD as strategic partners, integrating predictive analytics, developing collaborative sales cultures, and maintaining authenticity while embracing systematic approaches that drive measurable revenue growth.
10:20 - Morning Coffee Break

Networking and exhibitor engagement

Extended networking break designed to maximize delegate interaction and knowledge sharing. Exhibitor displays showcase latest technology solutions for professional services marketing and business development. Delegates connect with morning speakers, form professional relationships central to PSMG's community-building mission, and explore innovative tools for immediate implementation in their organizations.
11:00 - Workshop Session 1 (Choose 1 of 6 tracks):

Track A: Agentic AI in Marketing & BD
Lee Curtis & Sam Stamp (LINAR Consulting)

Groundbreaking workshop introducing agentic artificial intelligence's transformative potential in professional services marketing and business development. Unlike traditional AI automation, agentic AI represents intelligent systems that reason, plan, and take autonomous actions. Practical demonstrations show AI revolutionizing client research, opportunity identification, and proposal development while maintaining authenticity essential to professional services success. Participants engage with real-world case studies and develop implementation roadmaps balancing innovation with risk management.

Track B: Future-gazing Marketing in 2045
Shourik Chatterjee (EY Law)

Forward-looking workshop challenging delegates to envision and prepare for professional services landscape of 2045. Structured scenario planning exercises examine multiple potential futures, from AI-human collaboration to significant technological disruption. Explores changing client expectations, generational shifts, evolving regulatory environments, sustainability's role in decision-making, virtual/augmented reality impact, and pricing model evolution. Participants develop strategic recommendations for building adaptability and resilience into long-term planning while maintaining competitive advantage.

Track C: From "Support" to "Growth Drivers" with Data
Nick Condon & Rory Grant (Squiz)

Transformative workshop addressing persistent challenge of repositioning marketing and BD teams from cost centers to revenue generators through strategic data-driven digital experiences. Proven methodologies demonstrate marketing's direct contribution to firm profitability while building technological and analytical capabilities for sustainable competitive advantage. Detailed case studies from Gilbert + Tobin's transformation show how strategic content, platform integration, and analytics create measurable business growth. Delegates gain practical tools for digital maturity assessments and ROI measurement frameworks.

Track D: Creating a Sales Mindset
Amit Champaneri (Deloitte)

Intensive workshop transforming professional services practitioners' client engagement approaches, moving beyond traditional relationship-based models to systematic, value-focused sales methodologies enhancing both client satisfaction and business results. Deloitte's proven framework develops sales mindsets among technical professionals, demonstrating systematic approaches to conversation generation, value articulation, and impact measurement seamlessly integrated into professional services delivery. Includes role-playing exercises, case studies, and personalized action plans for immediate implementation.

Track E: AI and ROI Maximization
Paul Vetrone (Templafy)

Strategic workshop addressing critical challenge facing firms investing heavily in artificial intelligence: ensuring technology deployments deliver measurable returns while enhancing professional services delivery. Comprehensive framework for evaluating AI opportunities, measuring implementation success, and optimizing adoption for sustainable competitive advantage. Examines common pitfalls including inadequate change management and unrealistic expectations. Participants develop business cases, implementation roadmaps, and measurement systems tracking both quantitative and qualitative AI adoption impacts.

Track F: [Additional Workshop - TBC]

Final workshop track addressing cutting-edge developments in professional services marketing and business development, with speaker and topic details announced closer to event date. Session maintains summit's focus on practical, implementable strategies helping delegates drive immediate value within their organizations while exploring emerging trends and innovative approaches to professional services growth.
12:30 - Lunch & Networking

Extended networking break with exhibitors

Crucial networking component providing extended opportunities to discuss morning workshop insights, connect with potential collaborators, and engage with solution providers. Buffet format encourages informal conversation and relationship building often proving as valuable as formal sessions. Delegates explore technology solutions, share implementation experiences, and develop partnerships for ongoing professional development and business collaboration.
13:30 - "In Conversation With..." Panel

Moderator: Lee Curtis (LINAR)
Interactive Q&A with morning workshop leaders

Dynamic panel featuring morning workshop leaders in open discussion format, allowing delegates to pose questions, seek clarification on key concepts, and explore connections between different strategic approaches. Lee Curtis facilitates dialogue bridging theoretical frameworks with practical implementation challenges, ensuring delegates leave with actionable insights and clear next steps for applying morning learning to their specific organizational contexts.
14:00 - Global Perspectives Keynote

Helena Samaha (Lex Mundi President & CEO)
International professional services evolution

Essential global context examining how professional services transformation varies across markets while identifying universal trends shaping industry future. Drawing from Lex Mundi's unique position coordinating legal services across six continents, Helena explores technology adoption, client expectation evolution, and regulatory changes creating opportunities and challenges worldwide. Addresses cultural sensitivity in international business development, sharing adaptation strategies for different cultural contexts while maintaining service quality consistency and professional standards.
14:45 - Afternoon Tea Break

Short networking session

Shorter networking break maintaining energy and momentum while providing time to process international perspectives shared in Helena's keynote and prepare for afternoon workshop sessions. Delegates can connect with speakers, continue morning conversations, and explore additional exhibitor offerings before selecting their second workshop track.
15:15 - Workshop Session 2

Repeat of morning tracks - attend different session

Afternoon session repeats morning's six tracks, enabling delegates to participate in additional sessions and gain broader exposure to diverse strategic approaches presented throughout summit. Format recognizes that depth and quality of each workshop makes it valuable for delegates to attend multiple sessions, maximizing learning opportunities and strategic insights across different specialization areas.
16:45 - Closing Panel

Moderator: Owen Williams (Simmons & Simmons)
Strategic synthesis and forward planning

Strategic synthesis of day's learning, bringing together key themes and insights from all workshop tracks and keynote presentations. Owen facilitates discussion helping delegates identify priority actions for their organizations while addressing practical implementation challenges and resource requirements. Panel explores connections between AI, data analytics, sales excellence, and international perspectives, demonstrating integration into comprehensive transformation strategies while creating collaborative problem-solving environment.
17:15 - Closing Remarks

Gail Jaffa (PSMG)
Key takeaways and call to action

Gail synthesizes day's key insights while challenging delegates to embrace transformational opportunities discussed throughout summit. Emphasizes continued learning, collaboration, and implementation importance, highlighting PSMG's ongoing role supporting professional development and industry advancement. Sets stage for networking reception and encourages delegates to maintain momentum and connections formed during intensive learning day.
17:30 - Evening Reception

Networking drinks with live jazz ("Mayfair Jazz")
Continues until late

Relaxed environment for continued networking, relationship building, and informal discussion of implementation strategies. Live jazz performance creates elegant atmosphere encouraging conversation and relationship development, recognizing that many valuable professional connections form in informal settings. Reception provides opportunity to deepen connections made during formal sessions while celebrating shared commitment to professional services marketing excellence.
Key Learning Tracks:

    AI Integration: Practical implementation and ROI

    Sales Transformation: Culture change and methodology

    Data-Driven Growth: Marketing as revenue generator

    Future Planning: 2045 strategic preparation

    Global Perspectives: International market insights

    Leadership: Change management and resilience

Networking Opportunities:

    Registration breakfast

    Morning coffee (40 min)

    Lunch (60 min)

    Afternoon tea (30 min)

    Evening reception with live entertainment

Target Audience:

Marketing directors, business development heads, partners, and senior professionals from law firms, accounting practices, consultancies, and supporting industries across the UK and internationally.

parameters.subject: ={{ $('PSMG Event Webhook').item.json.body.data.conversation_initiation_client_data.dynamic_variables.first_name }}, a follow up from your call with Lottie ahead of the PSMG Summit on 11th November 2025

= The 2025 PSMG Full Day London Summit: Thriving in an age of continuous reinvention
Thanks for speaking with Lottie. Your tailored suggestions for the PSMG London Summit are inside.
 
Powered by

The 2025 PSMG Full Day London Summit: Thriving in an age of continuous reinvention

Hi there {{ $('PSMG Event Webhook').item.json.body.data.conversation_initiation_client_data.dynamic_variables.first_name }},

Thanks for taking the time to speak with me ahead of the PSMG London Summit. Based on our conversation, I have pulled together some suggestions below including recommended sessions to attend and people to speak to. For further information, please visit the website.

Enjoy the summit!

Lottie

Events AI Assistant
PSMG
Powered by Legal Engine
{{ $json.output }}

If you have enjoyed talking to Lottie and would like to explore employing her for your own event, please get in touch with the Legal Engine team by dropping us an email to info@legalengine.co.uk and/or come and say hello at the Summit!

© 2025 PSMG · psmg.co.uk · About Legal Engine · Unsubscribe

parameters.text:
=Your role is to produce a html formatted version of this text that will be embedded into an html email. I just need the output to be sections of formatted text covering the topics covered in the conversation ("Summary", "Recommended sessions", "Speakers to engage with", "Delegates to connect with", "Travel Plans").

In the "Speakers to engage with", list the name of the speaker and the session name. For example: 'Clare Murray — panelist on AI, pricing and operational change'

In the "Recommended sessions", list the day, the time and the session name. For example:'11:50 - Key Note Presentation - The Future of Law Firm Leadership'

In the "Delegates to connect with", list the name, role and company of the Delegate and a very short bio. For example: 'Lee Curtis, Managing Director at Legal Engine. Lee Curtis is a 20+ year legal industry veteran with experience across three continents including roles at Allen & Overy, Clifford Chance, Simmons & Simmons, and Clayton Utz.'

ONLY include the "Travel Plans" section if there is sufficient content provided in the call. If there is sufficient content produce a summary of what was discussed. 

I only need the body of the email, no opening and no sign off, just the main body formatted correctly with even spaces between the sections. If there is insufficient detail or information relating to any one section do not produce an output for that section. 

Text here: {{ $json['0'] }}

microsoftOutlookOAuth2Api.name: Microsoft Outlook - New Dec 2025 Leonard account

transcript.message: Hi Jen Shipley from Irwin Mitchell. I'm Lottie, one of the conference organisers here at PSMG. We're super excited to have you on board this year. True to the theme of this year's conference, we're continually finding ways to re-invent ourselves and have teamed up with Legal Engine to develop an agent (that's me by the way) to get your thoughts and interests ahead of the conference and help with any travel arrangements. Shall we get started?
Great. How has your week been so far?

rag_retrieval_info.retrieval_query: What is the purpose of the agent developed by Legal Engine?

transcript.message: Not too bad, just on the flat. He's doing well.

That's good to hear. So, to start, what are you hoping to get out of the PSMG Annual London Summit this year? Are you looking for specific AI use cases, business development impact, global insights, or perhaps leadership playbooks and team upskilling?

rag_retrieval_info.retrieval_query: How can I help with your travel arrangements?

transcript.message:
No problem at all. We've got some really interesting sessions lined up.

Given your role at Irwin Mitchell, I was thinking the workshop on 'Agentic AI in Marketing and BD' with Lee Curtis and Sam Stamp from LINAR Consulting might be particularly relevant. It's on from eleven AM to half past twelve. They'll be discussing practical AI integration for marketing and BD, which could offer some great insights for your firm.

Does that sound like something you'd be interested in?

rag_retrieval_info.retrieval_query: What are you hoping to get out of the PSMG Annual London Summit this year?

analysis.transcript_summary: Lottie, an AI agent, is assisting Jen Shipley from Irwin Mitchell with the PSMG Annual London Summit. Lottie inquires about Jen's goals for the summit, suggesting the 'Agentic AI in Marketing and BD' workshop. Jen is still considering her objectives.

True to the theme of this year's conference, we're continually finding ways to re-invent ourselves and have teamed up with Legal Engine to develop an agent (that's me by the way) to get your thoughts and interests ahead of the conference and help with any travel arrangements. Shall we get started?
